Articles.Content:
I request someone tape this and post to Youtube.

*spacegasm*

http://science.house.gov/hearing/full-committee-hearing-mars-flyby-2021-first-deep-space-mission-orion-and-space-launch

The only thing congress is really doing here is sitting and listening, there's no indication yet that they'll actually go for this (which is unfortunate, I'd really like to see this happen)

However, the fact they've agreed to sit and listen is nice!

Edited February 25, 2014 by NovaSilisko
Wasn't there a similar hearing (not full house, though) for Dennis Tito's Inspiration Mars program? I'm pretty sure they said no to that, and this is practically the exact same thing.

Wasn't there a similar hearing (not full house, though) for Dennis Tito's Inspiration Mars program? I'm pretty sure they said no to that, and this is practically the exact same thing.

It is basically the same, except the mission is something like 80 days longer and includes a Venus flyby on top of the Mars flyby.
2021? That's only two Presidential and four Congressional elections away! Also the entire Senate, with some seats being up twice.

2021? That's only two Presidential and four Congressional elections away! Also the entire Senate, with some seats being up twice.

Except that officers of Congress change seats less than a dictator.

Trust me, 90% of them will still be in Congress once 2021 rolls around
